page.title: 18TOURISM
page.content: The area is popular with tourists but fortunately it remains unspoilt. The people who come here do so to enjoy the countryside. There are few tourist facilities and since the roads in the area are narrow there is not too much traffic. Some of the farms also do bed and breakfast for around Â£8.00 per night or Â£10 per night to include an evening meal. The pub at Lowtrow Cross sells coffee and snacks and has an outdoor childens play area. In the field next to the pub there is a small caravan site where you can park your caravan for Â£3.00 per night between March and October. Some cottages may be rented during the summer, the cost per week for one sleeping five people is about Â£100 in he high season.
